article.paragraph: David Director Friedman(born February 12, 1945) is an Americaneconomist,physicist, legal scholar, andlibertarianismlibertariantheorist. He is known for his writings inanarcho-capitalistmarket anarchisttheory, which is the subject of his most popular book,The Machinery of Freedom(1973, revised 1989 and 2014). He has authored several other books and articles, includingPrice Theory: An Intermediate Text(1986),Law's Order: What Economics Has to Do with Law and Why It Matters(2000),Hidden Order: The Economics of Everyday Life(1996), andFuture Imperfect(2008).Free Market Mojo."An Interview with David D. Friedman".

article.heading: The Machinery of Freedom
article.paragraph: In his bookThe Machinery of Freedom(1973), Friedman sketched a form ofanarcho-capitalismwhere all goods and services including law itself can be produced by thefree market. This differs from the version proposed byMurray Rothbard, where a legal code would first be consented to by the parties involved in setting up the anarcho-capitalist society. Friedman advocates an incrementalist approach to achieve anarcho-capitalism by gradualprivatizationof areas that government is involved in, ultimately privatizing law and order itself. article.paragraph: Friedman is a longtime member of theSociety for Creative Anachronism, where he is known asDuke Cariadoc of the Bow.
